posts.name: Max Radermacher
posts.cooked:
Today, we‚Äôre releasing version 7.42 to beta. If you‚Äôre interested in participating, join the beta group.

Release notes:

  • The ‚ÄúFiles‚Äù filter in the media gallery can help you quickly find PDFs and other attachments, like the TXT that really could have been a text.
  • We switched the emoji reaction picker in the Stories tab to work with the dark theme, but the right reaction can still provide enlightenment.
  • VoiceOver accessibility improvements, including a label for the call ring button and new functionality to indicate when a message includes a quoted reply.
  • We also updated the design of the QR codes throughout the app. They‚Äôve always looked good in front of a camera, but they‚Äôre practically ready for a photo shoot now.

Let us know about any issues you experience! Thank you for being a beta tester!

In addition, this beta release enables a new feature we‚Äôre ready to test: linked device history syncing! In short, we‚Äôre using an end-to-end encrypted, device-independent backup format to optionally sync message history to newly-linked devices. This is a feature we‚Äôre super excited to release and we know many of you have been waiting for. We released a test run of this feature for Android ‚Üí Desktop linking before the holidays, and we‚Äôre now ready to open it up for iOS as well. (Please check out that forum post for more technical details and an FAQ!)

Specifically, with this beta you‚Äôll be able to sync message history:

  1. From a primary iPhone to a special Desktop build you can download from the earlier forum post.
  2. From a primary iPhone or Android to an iPad.

NOTE: Testing this involves a new linking of the device. The special Desktop build can be installed side-by-side with your existing Desktops, but unfortunately due to technical limitations we can‚Äôt do the same on iPad; so, testing this requires deleting existing Signal data from your iPad (either via Settings ‚Üí Account ‚Üí Delete All Data or by reinstalling) and re-linking. Re-linking will restore your message history and last 30 days of media, but as this is a new feature, bugs may exist; please use appropriate caution before deciding to test.

If you decide to test, please post logs (and any issues you encounter either during or after the sync) here or on the original forum post! They‚Äôre helpful both if there was an error and if it succeeded (so we can get a sense of things like performance).

Thank you, as always, for being beta testers. We couldn‚Äôt build these features without your help.

link_counts.title: Help us test desktop history syncing!
All Media should include documents / files
Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.41 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.42.0.538-beta

107 new commits since 7.41.3.519-beta (+ 1 commit omitted):

Show commits

  • Bump version to 7.42 [1]

  • Handle landscape and portrait layouts in provisioning QR code [2]

  • Order backup restore profile fetches by latest message [3]

  • Clean up post-link'n'sync step UX [4]

  • Don't insert contact info messages from contact sync after link'n'syncing [5]

  • Differentiate some upload logging based on error type [6]

  • Add internal debug logging for uploads [7]

  • Don't block on failure to delete TSAttachment folder [8]

  • Fix a few warnings [9]

  • Suspend message processing until link'n'sync finishes [10]

  • Reset the upload attempt count if progress was made in the prior attempt [11]

  • Fix "Learn more" button on secondary device link'n'sync [12]

  • Only archive edit history for standard messages [13]

  • Add MainActor annotations for db change observers [14]

  • Asyncify video segmenting logic [15]

  • Clean up SendMessageFlow and remove unused code [16]

  • Pass an NSProgress into the TSAttachment migration [17]

  • Improve Link'n'Sync primary progress animations [18]

  • Tweak link'n'sync progress percentages and estimates [19]

  • Replace all ugly QR codes with pretty ones [20]

  • One QR code generator to rule them all [21]

  • Fixes when sharing multiple body images/videos via system share sheet [22]

  • Add local user to whitelist on note to self restore. [23]

  • Unlink iPads on server when deleting all device data [24]

  • Don't ask for device name even if not link'n'sync'ing [25]

  • Force stories emoji reaction picker to be dark theme [26]

  • Add verified icon to Note to Self in recipient picker [27]

  • Remove text from call details back button [28]

  • Make PKPASS files a "known" generic file type [29]

  • Make TSAttachment migration non-blocking again [30]

  • Improve reduced transparency accessibility [31]

  • Schedule notification when new device is linked [32]

  • Add backup key code entry view controller [33]

  • Allow restoring quotes with no content [34]

  • Supply both getFoo and foo accessors for TSQuotedMessage.timestampValue [35]

  • Don‚Äôt move around Signal logo when unlocking [36]

  • Send outgoing device name change sync messages [37]

  • Fix conversation picker styling in share extension [38]

  • Prevent soft lock when tapping notification with image picker open [39]

  • Fix issue that shows send button when all the text is cut [40]

  • Fix crash when restoring a story message from job record [41]

  • Allow missing or zero sizes on restored backup attachments [42]

  • Reduce verbosity when launching [43]

  • Increase incoming message body bytesize threshold [44]

  • Asyncify MessageSenderJobQueue [45]

  • Remove the bulk of OWSOperation [46]

  • Add jitter to exponential backoff [47]

  • Add closure to override LinkingTextView link taps [48]

  • Improve call controls animations [49]

  • "Refresh" button in Prvsning QR code should restart auto-rotation [50]

  • Skip performBatchUpdates when updating footer height [51]

  • Remove usage of some ObjC types in Swift code [52]

  • Add & use CompletionSerializer [53]

  • Use viewWillTransition to set layout for provisioning QR codes [54]

  • Make voiceover read voice message times in mins+seconds [55]

  • Make transfer QR codes more scannable [56]

  • Add Select All button in media gallery [57]

  • Add "Files" media gallery filter [58]

  • [a11y] Add accessibility label for call ring button [59]

  • [a11y] Make Voiceover indicate when a message is a reply [60]

  • [a11y] Make Voiceover read out minutes instead of meters [61]

  • Parity in group/recipient BlockingManager methods [62]

  • Update text composer colors [63]

  • Allow deprecated_sourceDeviceId to be nil [64]

  • Record during registration that PNI Hello World is unnecessary [65]

  • Update URLSession timeout to 5 min for CDN requests [66]

  • [a11y] Do not open tx when getting accessibility label for reply [67]

  • Check for cancellation in backup import/export [68]

  • Don‚Äôt preemptively fanout oversize messages [69]

  • Remove unnecessary SwiftValues types [70]

  • Add "Delete for everyone" option to bulk message delete action [71]

  • Remove unused deps from AccountRecordUpdater [72]

  • Clean up some message backup error enum cases [73]

  • Remove LegacyChangePhoneNumber [74]

  • Move WhoAmI request making into a dedicated type [75]

  • Remove AccountServiceClient [76]

  • Use info from WhoAmI to decide if we need to redeem our subscription [77]

  • Asyncify RemoteConfig fetching [78]

  • Replace color assets with programmatic colors [79]

  • Fix sds codegen public imports [80]

  • Apply fixes from latest version of swiftlint [81]

  • Enable SSRE2 migration for beta [82]

  • Remove SignalServiceClient [83]

  • Add cancellation support to RESTNetworkManager [84]

  • Update provisioning footer font [85]

  • Enable SSRE2 migration for all builds [86]

  • Update copy under Transfer Account & Messages [87]

  • Prevent unread filter from incorrectly showing with high velocity swipe [88]

  • Update color references on hero sheet [89]

  • OWSChatConnection: Recreate ChatService for each connection [‚Ä¶] [90]

  • OWSChatConnection: Update libsignal shadowing implementation as well [‚Ä¶] [91]

  • Avoid redundant fetches in the call header [92]

  • Load group call view controller synchronously [93]

  • Don‚Äôt pass around TSGroupThread in group calls [94]

  • Remove anyReload methods from codegen [95]

  • Clean up zombie SVR code [96]

  • Run TSAttachmentMigration while the app is running; allow it to be run blocking but incremental [97]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.49.2 [98]

  • Clean up some deepCopy codegen [99]

  • Add error for failing to sync device with unsupported backup version [100]

  • Fix a few warnings [101]

  • Enable Link'n'Sync for beta [102]

  • Update to LibSignal v0.65.0 [103]

  • Fix warning when updating dm timer [104]

  • Update release notes [105]

  • OWSChatConnection: Use libsignal ChatConnection, replacing ChatService [106]

  • Update translations [107]

Localization changes

No localization changes fit in character limit. You can view the full comparison to 7.41.3.519-beta so far here. Localization changes for the release are the same, as this is the first build of the release.

posts.cooked:
This apparently resolved itself (possibly after an automatic update), but still curious why it was failing:

Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.41 release iOS Beta Feedback
Trying to help a friend transfer from an old iPhone to a new one but the transfer keeps failing saying the devices aren‚Äôt near each other, but they‚Äôre next to each other on a desk. Local network, WiFi, and Bluetooth are on. VPN is off. Not beta but hoping for some help since returning the old device is time-sensitive.
Log<a href="https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.41.3/b375a54228b355aa16ee1e70a6ba52ad476c4e8a50de44cf0fe019385e018c68.zip">https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.41.3/b375a54228b355‚Ä¶

Both devices are iPhone 15 Pro.

Edit: failed at about 90% last night .

Edit 2: worked on the third try.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Not seeing the files tab

Process of transferring old messages crashed when adding a linked iPad to my primary iPhone

iPhone: https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.42.0/eda8dfd183eea8f82b8259b8f9f846e59ac05e31e3efd575c4970a2581f94ce7.zip
iPad:
https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.42.0/28fe9551f9a2f1901e36b2af72ec52c2c4022254fba3ecd54d2055b7a89f7ce6.zip

The new files tab is nice!

Message transfer didn‚Äôt work for me though.

I tried linking this beta version to the adhoc Linux client. I got an error message on my iPhone to say the desktop device was linked, but my messages could not be transferred. None of my messages were transferred to the desktop client.

Debug log for mobile:
https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.42.0/2781e093f67a0f88d0ae3b60b7b3c0cc8e1b421fc74b622cd2ab2e7a0576627f.zip

https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.42.0/2781e093f67a0f88d0ae3b60b7b3c0cc8e1b421fc74b622cd2ab2e7a0576627f.zip

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked:
Sorry about this! It looks like the export from your iPhone failed with an issue we just became aware of. Stay tuned for a fix.

I‚Äôm assuming that on your iPad, it went through with a ‚Äúnormal‚Äù link, instead of the history transfer?

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked:
Thanks for the report! We‚Äôll look into the issue, and I‚Äôll post here when I have an update.

For context, we have validation that runs on the exported backup file‚Ä¶and we‚Äôve found many instances of data stored in old databases that results in backup files that fail validation (which we can then work around). Thanks for catching a new one :)

sashaweiss-signal:

I‚Äôm assuming that on your iPad, it went through with a ‚Äúnormal‚Äù link, instead of the history transfer?

Yes that‚Äôs right (20 char)

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: The latest beta update (build number 545) should address the issue you hit!

It worked!! Wow, what an amazing feature! 3 years of text messages imported in the space of a minute. I‚Äôm glad my report could help and thank you for your work!

Fixed, thank you! The iPad was still loading while my iPhone was already finished, but that wasn‚Äôt a problem for me :D

iPhone: https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.42.0/2bf5e8c8b61b73be97a9dc534b298a42f9d8c969f8af01b2de69a199c63fdf42.zip

iPad:
https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.42.0/72c488b7401142e4b0e1a17226ed0a07bb7ea4461cd286e06b7732320a672bcb.zip

Tried it again, no problems with the transfer itself :)
But after linking I receive a notification on the top left above my chats on the iPad reminding me of a ‚Äûnew payment‚Äú which is a transaction of MOB I received in 2021 and asking me for a backup. I don‚Äôt think this is necessary on a newly linked device

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
When attempting to transfer history from Android to iPad and failing, then proceeding with a normal link, notifications do not work in terms of push notifications. You get nothing. You must reregister push notifications to get them to work.

https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.42.0/917f80e1afcecbccfa450b89413a62986ffcd625229c5beaad2ba5c981c591fc.zip

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked:
That‚Äôs awesome! Glad it worked. The extra notifications for payments are‚Ä¶a known issue.

Thanks for reporting!

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: Interesting ‚Äì I don‚Äôt unfortunately see any logs of the failed import on the iPad. Would you mind re-submitting logs, potentially trying again before submitting the logs?

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
That may be because Android never uploads it since my backup fails validation before upload. Then I click continue without transferring after the failure on the Android side. On iPad I only get a message that linking failed, after which it seems to continue with the normal linking process.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî-

https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.42.0/faedf50955e358b7bd7d1f90858426b767d5457599bbda238a3949c7ab845c21.zip

Notifications never deliver on time.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî-
For imported group events from a restore, old group join requests still have the view button even if they‚Äôve already been dealt with.

After linking my iPhone to the desktop app and syncing chat history a couple of days ago, my iPhone message list is full of message requests from people I haven‚Äôt spoken to in years. At least some, if not all of them, no longer use Signal. Each chat contains old messages which we exchanged, followed by the option to accept or deny the message request.

Some of the message requests even come from people with the name ‚ÄúAccount deleted‚Äù (‚ÄúCuenta eliminada‚Äù).

The debug logs from my last post should be relevant for this

IMG_0007828√ó1696 176 KB
